summary: This document is an email from Jeffrey Epstein to Jes Staley discussing a presentation to a risk committee. Epstein advises Staley on how to approach the presentation, suggesting that others should present while Staley attends, to avoid him being seen as lecturing. The email contains a confidentiality notice indicating potential attorney-client privilege.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email, providing advice to Jes Staley regarding a presentation.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is the recipient of the email, receiving advice from Epstein about his presentation to the risk committee.

connections.description: Epstein and Staley are in communication regarding professional matters, indicating a relationship where Epstein offers advice to Staley.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein advises Jes Staley on how to present to a risk committee.
The email contains a confidentiality notice indicating it may be attorney-client privileged.
Epstein suggests that Staley should not be seen as lecturing the committee.
The communication is marked as confidential and unauthorized use is prohibited.
